item.title: Achieving zero gap between two steel pieces
item.description: In this video I show a surprising result about air flow at low pressures by putting a Metmo Cube in a vacuum chamber.

media:content.media:title: Achieving zero gap between two steel pieces
media:content.media:description: In this video I show a surprising result about air flow at low pressures by putting a Metmo Cube in a vacuum chamber.

item.title: Ostrich egg strength
item.description: Through a controlled experiment, I measure the maximum compressive force required to break the egg, demonstrating its biomechanical strength.

item.title: Trying to break a floating table
item.description: Testing the physics behind the incredible tensegrity structure to find out just how much weight it can really hold before it fails.

item.title: Can water trap light?
item.description: The fundamental principle behind fiber optics, using a simple stream of water and a laser. Discover how light can be effectively "trapped" and guided through water by constantly reflecting off the surface boundary.

item.title: Exploring the strength of a spider
item.description: The incredible relative strength of a spider. Measuring the weight the spider can lift or suspend, demonstrating the amazing biomechanics of arachnids

item.title: Calculating the energy required to cook an egg
item.description: Discover how many drops would theoretically be needed to boil an egg!

item.title: Achieving a perfect sphere
item.description: I saw this viral challenge and knew I had to try it! I'm taking a simple sheet of aluminum foil and grinding, hammering, and polishing it for hours to see if I can actually create a perfect, mirror-like sphere.

item.title: How to slow down the speed of light
item.description: We explore the difference between the constant speed of light in a vacuum and its slower group velocity in dense mediums

item.title: The twin paradox in action!
item.description: We break down Einstein's famous twin paradox to illustrate time dilation in special relativity. Discover how acceleration, not just velocity, causes a difference in the aging of the twins and why the frames of reference are not symmetrical.

item.title: What is the true nature of black?
item.description: We delve into the true definition of black, examining it both as the absence of electromagnetic radiation (light) and as the darkest known pigments (like Vantablack). Discover how our eyes perceive this ultimate shade and the science behind 'true' darkness.

item.title: How long does it take for a red hot steel ball to cool in a vacuum chamber?
item.description: Extreme physics: heat transfer without air or convection

item.title: Moonlight fire?
item.description: In this video I check if it is possible to start a fire with a magnifying glass and moonlight. I talk about the conservation of etendue.

item.title: 3D printing a diffraction pattern
item.description: Is it possible to 3d print a diffraction pattern?

item.title: Chickens are weirder than you thought
item.description: The fascinating biological mechanism that allows chickens to keep their heads perfectly still while their bodies move!

item.title: Can the strongest acid dissolve the hardest material?
item.description: We explore the fascinating limits of chemistry by pitting the world's strongest acid against the hardest material

item.title: The simple additive that stops water from splashing instantly
item.description: See how this substance acts like a liquid until stress is applied, making it "not splash" when hit hard.

item.title: Newton's Cradle: The classic physics toy is hiding a scientific secret
item.description: Demonstrating the fundamental laws of conservation of momentum and energy that govern this classic desk toy's unique motion.

item.title: Virtually scuba diving
item.description: Exploring the stunning immersive experience of virtual scuba diving!

item.title: Evanescent waves
item.description: Exploring the physics phenomenon where light waves penetrate a boundary even when total internal reflection occurs. Demonstrating how these non-propagating waves exist and their crucial role in advanced optics.

item.title: The scariest sound in the world
item.description: Exploring the chilling acoustics of the Aztec Death Whistle. Investigating the unique internal design that generates a sound eerily similar to a human scream and analyzing its deep psychological impact on listeners.
